item.title: Exploring Cross-Validation!
item.description: Here are some demonstrations of different cross-validation techniques. For a broad explanation of cross-validation, see the bottom of this post. Simple Holdout Cross-Validation Randomly splitting data into a training and testing set, once. Repeated Cross-Validation Leave-\(p\)-Out This algorithm randomly selects \(p\) observations to exclude from the training set. These \(p\) observations constitute the testing set. This process is repeated until all possible combinations of \(p\) data-points have been used as a testing set.
